reporting-org.narrative: Association for Reproductive and Family Health

title.narrative: Community Entry (Open Community Meetings and Advocacy)

description.narrative: This activity was designed with the key objective of mobilizing the target communities for acceptance and participation in the project. Target groups included: community leaders, leaders of youth groups and key gatekeepers. State Project staff organized series of meetings at the community/ward level in all the selected project states. The meetings provided space for introducing the project to the communities, as well as interaction between project staff and community.

activity-date.narrative: This activity was implemented over a period of 3 months because of the need to ensure that all project communities were involved in some way. The project is being implemented in a total of 320 communities spread across 16 LGAs in 4 project states.
